topic.title: Multiple users plugin doesn't work with already created account
topic.body: So I already had an account set up (this one) and when I enable Multiple users, it forced me to create a new ID instead of loading this one. Anyone knows what's going on?

topic.title: ZeroMe problems
topic.body:
I kept getting this error every time I try to reload ZeroMe
>[ite:1Lj1oP..QWY6 WebSocket handleRequest error: DatabaseError: database disk image is malformed in UiWebsocket.py line 82 > UiWebsocket.py line 270 > MergerSitePlugin.py line 64 > MergerSitePlugin.py line 78 > SiteManagerPlugin.py line 65 > SiteManager.py line 150 > Site.py line 55 > ContentManager.py line 43 > ContentManager.py line 310 > ContentDb.py line 119 > Db.py line 75 > DbCursor.py line 70 
 {"cmd":"mergerSiteAdd","params":"1UDbADib99KE9d3qZ87NqJF2QLTHmMkoV","wrapper_nonce":"736464e26359b2b37ab62a98b124ada19e56a0710a58c95a65637a698bad362d","id":5}]

Now It kept saying signing failed, file too large when posting even 1 character text post

Can anyone suggest a solution? I tried deleting ZeroMe, expanding site size limit but no luck

topic.title: Something Productive
topic.body: Tell me things that you do to keep yourself productive, just wanna hear it out ;)

topic.title: Risk of zites makes connection to clean net?
topic.body:
Clean net links is on ething but how can you know if a Zite's script or videos/media loader are not making connections that could potentially make you lose your anonymity? 
Is there a quick way to check?

1_17AMQVbBa12XB3xFWKDnP2dCEx92TaiY7X.body: So when i switch on Multiple users plugin, my account doesnt work @.@ even though I didn't mess with the seeds or keys yet

1544353154_1JcHMiQxXHX9q3ZK2LF9rZjvg3MUt.body:
> [blurhy](#comment_198_1JcHMiQxXHX9q3ZK2LF9rZjvg3MUtTpcK): What's that

PerfectDark is like a file sharing p2p service that doesn't seem to require a tracker, they seems to be using DHT and something called DKT(distributed keyword table) so idk if It'd be useful. 
> wiki: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perfect_Dark_(P2P)

1544703954_1GHXQ3vMtadfHFjTwS3roqYe8LUsy.body:
As for what I know,
**Freenet** - deals with website by encrypting them into blocks. To open, clients have to gather the right blocks and decrypt it. Freenet took up lots of hard drive space because peers are required to store and distribute the blocks. Another down side is by using blocks, website can't be change easily afterward.

**ZeroNet** - instead does not encrypt (not that I'm aware of, *good posibility of derping*) and serve website as is so opening once you got them downloaded is straight forward and fast. ZeroNet was built for dynamic changes to sites (a very good example is [ZeroMe - basically twitter like](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/) and this opens up a wide range of possibilities.

> [timelinehyperbot](#comment_84_12JYCt1Mj1Fa7GA9N67HAxP6NiBHVWK9GS): Very similar, but Zeronet is different... [...]

wow the timing :))))

1566679861_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2.body:
> [opisafag](#comment_8_1FRms99LhV6SmTBPxkNbr99GXGjf8na3k2): I meant topics with correct answer as in things like elementary school math. If there are valid opposing viewpoints, then there isn't a single correct answer.

> [znnex](#comment_47_1GP1GwsgiyybaHxGxfTEbsMCqRS9ogd1nJ): I disagree with most of this. Do all conversations have to take place on Reddit? The OP already mentions connecting with other services.What's the difference between a post with 10 points vs....

Well Since there's no 'referee' or authority figure there to make the judgement about which is the right and which is the wrong, the best thing we can rely upon is the collective knowledge of the people who's participating in the conversation (aka peer review kind of sorting). Which indeed have it's down side for not being totally accurate but I think it's the best given the situation, the thing I'm worried about that since there'll be allowing for anonymous posting, people can make bots that down play (voting down) other's ideas. This shouldn't be too much of a prevalent problem but could cause a lot of confusion in some certain moments.

> + Per-subreddit settings:
>  * Allow users to post anonymously;
>  * Require user certificate.

> [gitcenter](#comment_768_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): No, you'll only be able to post anonymously, there'll be no way to vote anonymously.

That's nice to hear, it'd solve a handful of bot issue :)

So I've fixed the bug but here's what I think happened 
   -  I didn't properly shut down 0net ([gitcenter](#comment_939_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di):) so the same error appeared
   - Deleted the plugin folder manually  data\__plugins__\1NAMEz7stUPZErkV1d3yLkVWQFa4PTqDNv in order to access zites again.
   - The site still sees that I installed name.yo when I try reinstalling, so I have to recover It from my recycle bin to update or else I wont see it in http://127.0.0.1:43110/Plugins
